programme.title: A Long Weekend in... With Rory O'Connell
programme.desc: Rory O’Connell’s brand new series combines travel and cookery with the popular chef enjoying the culture as well as the cuisine of eight European cities – Palma de Mallorca, Vienna, Lisbon, Madrid, Bath, Nantes, Copenhagen and Edinburgh. Rory visits a different city in each episode, and while the primary focus is on food, Rory is a knowledgeable guide to so much more, with art and design being particular interests of his. Food becomes much more interesting when seen in context – the culture it is part of the landscape it’s produced in, the history that has influenced it. At the end of each episode, Rory makes a delicious dish with the local produce which he sources on his travels.

programme.title: Discover The World: Canyons, The Deep Wounds Of The Earth
programme.desc: Endless and spectacular, canyons illustrate the erosive power of flowing water, with rivers carving rock over millions of years to create immense rock formations.

programme.title: Places To Love
programme.desc: Samantha kicks off her visit to the Garden State in Cape May, and discovers how it played a pivotal role in the fight to end slavery. Samantha visits Beach Plum Farm and talks with a conservationist at the Wetlands Institute about the ground-breaking research they are doing. Other stops include Monmouth Battlefield State Park, Source Farmhouse Brewery and legendary music venue, The Stone Pony.

programme.title: Epic Exploring
programme.desc: In this episode Josh travels to Tallinn in Estonia with urban explorer Steve Duncan where they explore Patarei Prison

programme.title: The Magic Of...
programme.desc: Botique travel series focusing on regions

programme.title: A Long Weekend in... With Rory O'Connell
programme.desc: Rory O’Connell’s brand new series combines travel and cookery with the popular chef enjoying the culture as well as the cuisine of eight European cities – Palma de Mallorca, Vienna, Lisbon, Madrid, Bath, Nantes, Copenhagen and Edinburgh. Rory visits a different city in each episode, and while the primary focus is on food, Rory is a knowledgeable guide to so much more, with art and design being particular interests of his. Food becomes much more interesting when seen in context – the culture it is part of the landscape it’s produced in, the history that has influenced it. At the end of each episode, Rory makes a delicious dish with the local produce which he sources on his travels.

programme.title: Raw Travel
programme.desc: For decades Costa Rica has been luring surfers and eco-travelers to experience its killer waves on the coasts and its unique bio-diversity in the rain forest. We find out why travelers, from first timers to hard core veterans, consistently rave about Costa Rica, Latin America’s undisputed eco-tourism champion. There will be zip-lining (of course!), wild crocodile feeding, bat cave touring, snake handling and a whole lot more!

programme.title: Going Beyond
programme.desc: Going Beyond is wanderlust-filled hitchhiker Mariia Khandus’s new travel project. She’s journeyed around the world. Everybody knows that Thailand, Vietnam, and Indonesia are great places to relax with wonderful beaches and delicious fruits! But what do you know about the local people? The expats? About the real lives of those living in these exotic countries? In our trip, we will discover it all, together! We visit the non-touristy places and show you the real Indochina! This is a set of stories of different people, through the prism of whom we show life in a country. It is a collection of diverse achievements, experiences and emotions. We are looking for the most interesting stories for you to keep expanding your own consciousness. Unbelievable panoramic views, interesting people, exciting stories and adventures – you’ll see all of this in our travel show, Going Beyond!

programme.title: Gourmet Escapes
programme.desc: Arriving in Tel Aviv, the culinary centre of Israel, Chef Massimo decides to have a relaxing evening dinner, instead, he is treated to an eye opening cooking demonstration by a very animated chef. In the morning he visits Tel Aviv's magnificent beach waterfront then meets up with Chef Oved Alfia and together cook-up a delectable morning treat. From here he heads back to Jerusalem to meet up with Chef Moche Basson to grab ingredients at the Old Jerusalem Market....It's a real treat.

programme.title: It’s How You Get There
programme.desc: Sam, Julian, and Jenn experience a variety of exciting modes of transportation as they journey across the country. They use things such as trucks, cars and motorcycles, and they also experiment with ATVs, boats, jet skis, and air travel. Each episode features their competition with each other, including wagers, witty banter and adrenaline to keep the viewers entertained. They are continuously learning as they try out these new modes to see which one they consider the best. This is "It's How You Get There".

programme.title: American Travelers
programme.sub-title: American Travelers: Hawaii The Big Island
programme.desc: Dave & Kari visit the big island of Hawaii and see some of the most stunning beaches in the world.

programme.title: Hayman's Way
programme.desc: Follow David Hayman as he unearths the people and places that make Scotland unique.

programme.title: World Tour
programme.desc: In the thrilling travel show “World Tour,” viewers embark on captivating adventures to the most exotic corners of the planet. From the charming streets of Paris to the breathtaking landscapes of New Zealand, each episode offers new amazing places, cultures, and traditions. With inspiring stories from locals and unexpected discoveries, “World Tour” immerses viewers in the exciting world of travel and adventure.
